definitions.text:
Aforehand
 [afore hand.]
1. In time previous; by previous provision; as, he is ready aforehand She is come aforehand to anoint my body. Mark 14:8.
2.

Prepared; previously provided; as, to be aforehand in business. Hence in popular language, amply provided; well supplied with the means of living; having means beyond the requirements of necessity; moderately wealthy. The word is popularly changed into aforehanded, beforehanded, rather forehanded; as, forehanded farmer.
